column5: Hey all,  Just curious if anyone has dealt with this Canadian based website for ordering parts for a Maytag dryer. If you have ordered parts on line with another company, who were they and what was the service like?  Thanks for any input.  Cheers, Ron...
Send Mercman a PM with what you need Ron. He's helped me and a few others that I know of on the board. Service and price were great.
Send Mercman a PM Ron... from what I've heard nobody can beat his prices or service.
Were you looking over my shoulder Wayne? lol!
Hey, I think I will send Mercman a PM, from what I have been told, you can't beat his service or prices.  Thanks guys!  Cheers, Ron...

sounds like mercman can help you out....but if not, I have used partselect before and no problems...ordered some stove parts, at my door a little less than 2 weeks later (probably 7 or 8 business days, it was over the wknd), I was happy...didn't research how competitive their prices were, my total bill was 70ish so i was ok placing the order right away
Yes merc is the man, even sent me FREE screwdrivers with my order!

So, what are we looking for Ron? Parts Select are ok, but they play a little dirty.Not useing proper manufacturers part numbers, so you cant check priceing or find the part anywhere else but them. Feel free tp drop me a PM anytime at all. I can even do the research right here and right now LOL.
I have to say that Paul's service was VERY fast and I knew I didn't need to shop around.  so another vote for mercman.
you can't figure it out from right at the start?
I dont sell dryers Geoff.......but i could order the parts so he can build one
As it turned out, I didn't actually need parts for my Daughters Range, but Paul was a tremendous help to me with great info!
